segments.text: I see the indoor kitchen, bright from the daytime window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The adult is facing away, drying a dish intently.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink's faucet is on, but the water's not draining.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's overflowing, drenching the cabinets and floorâ€”disgusting!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle grows, slick and unclean underfoot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She stands in it, oblivious to the filth spreading.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stack on the counter, soon to be affected maybe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Nearby, a boy's on a stool, raiding the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His reach is bold, plate in hand like a shield.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl assists, her palm up in anticipation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This cookie heist amid the mess is almost comical.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet the stool's tilt worries me, unstable as it is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The window's view of the tidy garden mocks the interior sloppiness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I cringe at the potential for slips and spills.
segments.speaker: PAR
